intro: Leucanthemum vulgare subsp. vulgare, commonly known as the common oxeye daisy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It features a rosette of silver-gray basal leaves and produces showy white ray flowers with a yellow disc in the center. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is commonly found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils, and is known for its ability to bloom throughout the summer. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
